This is the nameof the routine which will be called if the Status of the contract changes to 'REV'- i.e. it is reversed. This routine will have 8 parameters as follows in the same order :
APPLN,TRAN.ID,APPLN.REC,RECORD.ID,BASE.APPLN.REC,PASS.CONTRACT.BALANCES,
PRODUCT.GROUP,PRODUCT.GROUP.REC
where APPLN - The Application to which the contract being processed belongs - this will be the BASE.APPLICATION , if there is one specified.
TRAN.ID - this is the Id of the contract being processed.
APPLN.REC - the contract record.
RECORD.ID - the Base Key Id , if any - else Blank
BASE.APPLN.REC - the Base Application Record, if any - else Blank..
PASS.CONTRACT.BALANCES - this is an Input / Output Parameter - which will contain the modifed contract balances record.
PRODUCT.GROUP - the ID of the IAS.PRODUCT.GROUP picked up.
PRODUCT.GROUP.REC - the PRODUCT.GROUP record of the contract.
Should be a valid Subroutine - i.e. should have a PGM.FILE entry of type S.
40 digit Alphanumeric Input.

This multivalue field along with the fields - BALANCES.FIELD and MAP.ACTION is used to specify the mapping of information from the underlying contract to the corresponding Contract Balances record.

This field will define when the mapping is to take place.Depending on the value in this field , mapping takes place either at the authorisation stage when a contract is first Input (MAP.ACTION = BUILD) or later anytime when the contract is modified (MAP.ACTION = MODIFY)
Should be either BUILD / MODIFY.

A Y / N field to indicate if the contract balances record is to be built when a contract is input or not. If this field is set as 'Y', then the contract balances record will be built at authorisation stage

If this flag is set to 'N' then the contracts Input are written into the IAS.CONTRACTS.PENDING file and the contract balances record for those contracts will be built at EOD. The user can also choose to build the contract balances record for such contracts adhoc using the Verify Template IAS.BUILD.CONT.BALANCES.
A Y / N field.
Mandatory Input.
This field contains the name of a field from the BASE application which forms the key for this rate type
Should be a valid field from the BASE application
Associated mulitvalue field with RATE.TYPE
Optional field.
Should of the format BASE*FIELD.NAME
If field name is alone entered , then defaults to the above format.

The name of the BASE.APPLICATION which holds the information for the corresponding Contract Balances record to be built. This along with the BASE.KEY field will be used to pick up information for the contract balances record.

For most Applications, this will be the same as the application. This would be different in such cases as for when IAS.APPLICATION.PARAM is setup for SECURITY.TRADE - where it may be required that a Contract Balances record is generated for each of the customer in the trade - in such cases the APPLICATION would be SEC.TRADE, the BASE.APPLICAITON would be SC.TRADING.POSITION and the BASE.KEY the field CUSTOMER.NO from SEC.TRADE.
In this case the ID of the contract balances record would be the CUSTOMER.NO .
Should be a valid Application installed in T24.
35 character Alphanumeric Input.

A YES / NO field to indicate if the ACTUAL.GROUP field of the contract balances record needs to overwritten with the new group calculated if any. If this field is left Blank , then it is taken as 'NO'
YES / NO field.

This multivalue field along with the next 2 fields - APPL.FIELD and MAP.ACTION is used to specify the mapping of information from the underlying contract to the corresponding Contract Balances record.
For e.g. if the field CURRENCY(field 2) in the Contract Balances record is to be mapped from the field CURRENCY of the LD record, at the authorisation stage then the setup would be as:
9. 1 BALANCES.FIELD. CURRENCY
10. 1 APPL.FIELD..... MAIN*CURRENCY
11. 1 MAP.ACTION..... BUILD
Should be a valid field in the IAS.CONTRACT.BALANCES file.

This is the nameof the routine which performs the same function as the Build Routine i.e. it will modify the static details ( such as cureency, classification etc.) of the contract balances record - the contract balances fields modified by the routine will take effect only if the field is one which can be modified by an API - such as a static information field. This will be called for existing Contract Balances records , if there is a change to the underlying contract and thus allows different actions to be applied at modification as opposed to Input.This routine will have 8 parameters as follows in the same order :
APPLN,TRAN.ID,APPLN.REC,RECORD.ID,BASE.APPLN.REC,PASS.CONTRACT.BALANCES,
PRODUCT.GROUP,PRODUCT.GROUP.REC
where APPLN - The Application to which the contract being processed belongs - this will be the BASE.APPLICATION , if there is one specified.
TRAN.ID - this is the Id of the contract being processed.
APPLN.REC - the contract record.
RECORD.ID - the Base Key Id , if any - else Blank

Should be a valid Subroutine - i.e. should have a PGM.FILE entry of type S.
40 digit Alphanumeric Input.
